The rest tried to climb over it, but this was not at all what Chantal wanted. She took a deep breath and incinerated those climbing over, superheating the crumbled steel and concrete as well as starting several fires. Now that this way was impassable, the hordes streamed off in the correct direction, towards the dragoness's partner in chaos Tara. Repeating the process a few times, Chantal left no available route but towards the other giantess. What the demon was now engaged in was immoral, illegal, and unmentionable even by Hell's standards. Grinning, Chantal turned back towards her original target, leaving the screams of tinies and Tara's moans behind. She spread her wings and took to the air. The huge transport helicopters still hovered around, occasionally dropping things off or extracting clumps of people who had escaped the destructive pair. The enormous dragon approached at startling speed, but the gunships didn't try to stop her. In fact, Chantal was a little worried. Shouldn't they be trying everything to stop her? But these thoughts fell to the back as she charged closer. She never heard the incoming jets or the missiles until they were long gone.

Chantal awoke amid the wreckage of a short, squat apartment block. The sky was ashen gray, and Tara hovered over her. Everything hurt. It felt as if every part of her had been peeled off, stretched out, then reattached and stapled together. The slightest twitch brought indescribable pain. Forcing open one eyelid, Chantal surveyed the damage to herself. She choked back a scream, knowing it would only make everything worse. Her skin was roasted to a charred black, and in large swaths the skin had been completely destroyed and singed muscle was visible. There were a few patches where her scales persisted, but they were cracked and blackened and as they fell off, she found they concealed the most grievous wounds. When she had calmed down, she looked back up at Tara. The other giantess held a fistful of humas, and she selected one to chew over thoughtfully as she surveyed Chantal.

"I was wondering if you'd wake up. I tried to do what I could, but my specialty isn't really in healing and almost never for the living. But I've taken enough souls in that the sheer power behind my clumsy attempts was enough to keep you alive. The rest you should be able to do yourself. It's actually a little scary how quickly you heal. When I was done, some of the deeper wounds went straight down to the bone. I think you just might need a little strength and time," Tara said with as much concern as could be expected from a demon. Chantal grunted in response. She was immensely grateful for her new friend's actions, but she now realized she was distractingly hungry. More hungry than she'd been in a very long time. Tara must have seen the way she looked at the last few people held in her hands.

"Hungry? I would be too after almost a week. Thankfully, I've had almost a week to prepare. I went out into the rest of the city and some larger suburbs. I brought enough of the population back so we have enough food and entertainment for as long as we want. But I'd guess you probably want to eat, so let me help you with that." The titaness reached somewhere behind Chantal and fiddled with something. Then she gently pushed the dragoness's head backwards, and opened her mouth. Above her was a dull metal platform split down the middle. Tara flicked a switch, and the two metal flaps fell, dropping hundreds of terrified humans down onto her open mouth. Most just bounced off and either fell to their deaths or rolled along Chantal's injured body, eliciting small stings and jabs of pain. But enough fell into her mouth and eventually into her gullet to satisfy the gigantic hunger. With this pressing matter addressed, the pain rose up and forced unconsciousness back upon her.
121321122.title: The planes return

1213211221.content:
Back in another Hell hole. Scott had barely escaped his last one, and now found himself plunged straight into a new one. The military had been excellent at quietly inserting him into the city in the midst of the evacuation. Despite everyone's strong misgivings about using people as live bait, the plan had been pulled off. It would have gone better if a demoness hadn't arrived to help the injured dragoness. Now Scott had to actually stay and fight the giant mistake. He made his lair where he had before, in the cool, damp sewers. This time though, he had his pick of weapons, armor, and material. He was focused entirely on killing a giantess. But things were different here too. Slipping into the body armor he'd been provided, Scott selected an excellently made machete along with a silenced handgun for tonight's excursion. Loud noises like gunshots drew one of the titanesses in record time. The key was stealth. Like a ghost, the embittered man slipped through a manhole cover and onto the hostile streets.

A host of things were different in Scott's new city. He didn't have to worry about roving bands of thugs, the demoness had done an excellent job of cleaning them up. But that wasn't much different, the brazen ones had been the first to be devoured by the dragoness back home. Instead, the few free survivors had to worry about demonic death squads. They used brutal medieval weaponry that left something inside cuts that allowed Tara to track your location. Scott had seen a pretty grisly scene of a group of humans triumphing over a group of demons only to be suddenly crushed beneath the bottom of the purely evil woman. So Scott made it his personal side mission to kill demons until he found a way to get close to the injured dragon. Then, all he had to do was slip a specially honed blade into her scaly hide and permanently silence her malicious heart. Lost in these ruminations, Scott almost passed the subway stop he had been advancing towards.

Four figures wrestled by the entrance. One was a terrified human, a girl of about twenty. The other three were demons, horribly disfigured in mind and body. Scott knew exactly what the demons had planned for the girl, a long and drawn out torture followed by a brutal feast on her flesh. The leader looked particularly excited as he forced her down. His final expression was quite amusing as the heavy machete blade sliced through tough sinew and brittle Satanic bone. The other two drew weapons, but the attacker had already melted back into the shadows. One backed up against a stout tree, ensuring the ghost had to advance from directly in front of him. Silently, the tree unfolded its black-clad arms and sliced his throat. Dropping the body, it advanced on the final panicked demon. It quaked in fear as the figure, black as the shadows it hid in, advanced. It's blade dripped with the gore of his companions and the beast could almost hear it cry for his blood. The figure's head gained color as an awful row of pale teeth revealed themselves in a grim mockery of a smile. It guestured down the subway entrance.

"Run."

The demon dove down the stairs, crying for its companions. Scott approached the petrified woman. She almost broke when she saw his horrible scarred face, thinking that an even worse apparition had come for her. Instead, the man roughly shoved a map in her hands and stood above the entrance to the train station. Torches lit up the night moments later as twelve more of the demons tried to pour out of the station. Their howls of bloodlust drained to cries of fear and dismay, and finally silence as the automatic pistol made short work of the beasts. Then the figure melted back into the night.
1213211221.title: Great Scott!

12132112211.content:
Tara was displeased. And bad things happened when she was displeased. As her general staff for the excursion into the realm of the living had just discovered to their displeasure. When the head of operations had reported the loss of another squad, Tara had slammed her fist down on him in frustration, smattering chunks of Hellish gore everywhere. The servants that came to wipe the mess up found themselves backhanded across the enormous table. Tara leaned back in her chair, made from the skeleton of a fallen skyscraper and Other various debris. The table was made from one of the few species of trees that grew in Hell. Various other officers in charge of different aspects of the attack had places at the table. Most of these were on raised sections created so the lesser demons might seem slightly more important to the colossal titaness seated at the head. However, the aged and dried ichor that had seeped into the woodwork showed a certain intolerance for failure. The current general staff had seen numerous executions for failure, but never had their leader killed someone so high ranking, and then idly killed two servants as well. She casually flicked off a bit of the blood, sprinkling the logistics officer with his commander's remains. Tara seemed placated for a moment, her face losing the murderous shadow for a moment. Then she directed a gout of purple flame at the farthest office, smiling wickedly as the three representatives shrieked horribly while burning to death. Her flattened palm flattened the hapless logistics officer. Several other officers of posts not particularly important to Tara fell into her gaping mouth, and were ground to dust by angry molars. The military postmaster she violently seized, breaking several bones in the process. The giantess squeezed him tighter, savoring his looks of silent pain, as he was only capable of communicating through writing. Finally, he burst like a huge boil of pus. The rest remained dutifully still as they were slaughtered.

Breathing heavily and covered in the remains of her commanders, Tara glared about the setting for someone else to take her anger out on. Just up a few streets were the human detention camps, and the jail for her own troops caught in some infraction was even closer. But her friend was injured and would need many of the humans to recover, and she had just pardoned a large number of her prisoners. Finally her gaze fell upon the final living being in the vicinity. A smaller demon dressed in a white suit attempted to make himself very small while not appearing tone hiding from the raging giantess.

"Can you lead an army better than these failures did?" Tara said slightly menacingly, her massive body towering over the demon, which barely topped five feet. It quaked helplessly, and croaked out a few words too quiet for Tara to hear. She leaned closer, her enormous breasts threatening to crush the hapless servant.

"Louder, if you don't mind." The temperature in her voice dropped a few degrees.

"I was designated a servant, I know nothing of leading military operations," it said, hoping the fact she hadn't instantly pulverized him meant something positive. It didn't. Tara grabbed him, screaming about the utter I effectiveness of all her minions, and the only responses to problems being excuses.

"You are going to die a very slow and painful death. But first you will wish you had never come into existence. When I finally finish you, you will thank me," the giantess said, the tiny demon clutched in her hands shaking despite the tight grip. It already wished that it hadn't been born, or at least been allowed to die painfully in battle. After having to clean up several of the demoness's victims, he was fully aware of what was in store for him.

Tara was blind with rage, rage at everything. Unfortunately, this tiny insignificant speck of a being was the only thing she could take her anger out on. This was usually the mood in which she surfaced in some realm and annhiliated entire cities. But sadly for her hapless victim, he would be the sole recipient. But then the giantess noticed something. Being from the underworld, and controlling an amount of power that certainly put her in the running for most powerful thing there, she could see quite a bit about another being at first glance. The whelp of a demon in her hand did not die anytime soon. Which must mean something must placate her in the next few seconds. And indeed, it did. Tara was placated enough to place the demon back amid the mutilated corpses of her generals, apologize, and follow up on an idea she had had.
12132112211.title: With Tara

choices: “Suit me up, General.  I will pass through the flames as a ghost of vengeance."
“Give me the dragon bottle. If I can be healed, I will kill her and be avenged."
121322.content:
“That man has been on the operating table for 46 hours, sir. There is no way that he could have recuperated this fast without some physical enhancement. And I know for sure that WE did not administer one to him.”

“Perhaps he just had a drive to survive. If he is able to survive that burning hell blast, then he might be anxious to go for Round 2 with Chantal.”

Scott swam back to consciousness against a torrential pain. He felt itchiness everywhere on his body. As he opened his eye, the first thing he observed was the surgical spotlights over his apparently flat body. He tried to move his arms and legs, but they were strapped down to an operating table. A husky voice emerged from his throat, “Where am I?”

Two men walked into the light from the shadowed parts of the room. “Mr. Scott Cross? I am General Thornsides. I am responsible for the rescue aid and evacuation process that is now is occurring in the Los Angeles city area. This gentleman here is Sir Geon, the chief weapons engineer of the East Coast Branch of the C.O.D.F.I.S.H. Inc. We want to offer you a proposition.”

“Where am I? The last things I remember were the screams of my venturing partner, the heat of the flames and falling backwards into a dark tunnel. There was a vague image of the appearance of some guys, and buzzed conversations where Death and Christ argued over my soul.” Scott tried to roll his head, but he felt cushions holding his head still.

Sir Geon, with head bowed, stepped forward. He answered, “You were found in the Los Angeles subway lines. The medivac brought you to San Diego, and you have been receiving treatment for nearly 2 days, to try and remove the burnt tissue from your body. However, it appears that we have complications where the burns went through the skin and muscle, right down to your bone structure in certain places.”

“Sir, I need to see what happened to me,” Scott muttered.

“I understand. We have been trying to restore as much as possible. Please forgive us,” Sir Geon murmured an apology as he pulled a remote from his lab coat pocket.

A TV screen lit up, situated right in front of Scott’s vision. He was a burned out skeleton. His face was crusted black, with no nose or lips, and a white gloss where the skull broke through the burns. His arms and legs were blackened with third degree burns, on three-quarters of the surface; the rest of the limb was blistered red, from the indirect heat of Chantal’s furnace blast. His chest was striped in black skin, exposed red muscle tissues, and white rib bones. The scene of horror was completed with needles and tubing protruding from various cavities in Scott’s scarred body.

Scott screamed, “AHHHGH. She did this, she did this to me. AHHGH. It hurts all over; even my back itches.” Scott squirmed on his back, trying to rub the itch away.

“Actually, your back received only slight 3nd degree burns from the blistering heat, rather than black charring. Whatever surface you were attacked on, it protected you from total damage. As the situation stands, you should be dead from the lack of treatment and time delay to get on the surgical tables.”

Scott processed the medical diagnosis. He answered in a raspy voice, “Wait, if I am in a hospital, then you could approach with outside medical help. Chantal cut off the city for two years. We haven’t had a hospital, even a triage, since this April, when she started hunting the airdrop supplies. WHERE is Chantal?”

“She left,” the general announced. He turned the TV to a news channel, showing balls of fire, collapsing buildings, and two colossal creatures grabbing at the humans on the streets. “She vanished for nearly 24 hours, and suddenly appeared in the harbor outside of San Francisco. Chantal seems to have started to terrorize that city. Even worse, she has a new friend. Another 200 foot creature, with red skin and leather clothes, appeared right out of the ground in the city, and joined up with her. The evacuations were not fast enough, and she has already penned in the city. At the rate she is going, Chantal and the new creature, which is called Tara by inside news reports, could demolish San Francisco within a year, moving on to another city.”

Before a fireball smashed near the camera crew, Sir Geon turned off the television. He looked down at Scott. He whined, “General, sir, I still think that this is a poorly thought out idea. Mr. Cross has been put through too much physical damage. Sending him anywhere would be to commit murder, and just a waste of technology or chemicals.”

Scott groaned, “What are you talking about? Send me where?”

“Son, we need to ask you a favor. Of the remaining survivor accounts gathered in the past days, your name, and those of your associates, has popped up in stories all over the Los Angeles city. It seems that you were Chantal’s number one thorn. You know the dragon girl better than anyone alive. We want to send you into San Francisco, with the intent to kill Chantal and her friend.”

“Don’t screw with me.” Scott looked at both gentlemen. “You’re serious? You want to send a dead man to do your dirty work? Don’t make me laugh,” Scott shut his eyes and guided a laugh through his burnt throat.

Sir Geon sighed, “See there, sir? He’s been through enough. He suffered through his own hell, and won’t partake of your suicide mission. We would be better off trying to find one of the colleagues.”

“Good luck with that.” Scott grunted, and counted on his blackened fingers, “Jeff and Cindy can be found in a cinders pile, burnt in a building together. If the time is long enough, Larry will be in a pile of dragon guano, somewhere in San Francisco; I saw him get mulched and swallowed. As for the last member of my team, Saul might be dead, but not from the dragoness. He had gambling issues that forced me into the predicament that you see before you. Stupid deadbeat won’t last a minute against her; he was our doorman, nothing more.” Scott darted his eyes between the two men. “If you want that dragoness hide, I am your best shot. But she won’t twiddle her thumbs and wait for me to recuperate, or for me to pass my Intel on to some of your flunkies.”

The general placed his hand on the sterile strap on the surgery table. “Boy, you got spunk. I had wanted to send you in, but the good doctor here wanted to make sure that we were not forcing this on you.” General Thornsides waved Sir Geon over, and pointed into the darkness that still rimmed the surgical room’s edges. Sir Geon stepped away from the table.

“There are two ways that we can expedite your recovery. Of the two, we would appreciate if you could choose one of them, and we will suit you up for a war with the gargantuan monster women in San Francisco.”

Sir Geon rolled up a gurney table, with a small vial and a sponge. He lectured, “The first option is a biological solution. We were able to harvest some of the chemical solution that Chantal was soaked in. This could allow you to become a dragon-human-warrior. You will receive a controlled and small dose of liquid, applied to your skin. This will give you some, not all, of her traits. The chemical will allow you skills such as armored scales for protection against her fires, regenerative powers to heal your own tissue, dragon wings for flight, and the dragon tail for special ops. However, there are a number of factors that the scientists confirm will not happen. She grew to such large proportions because of the irregularly high, yet unmeasured, dosage. There also may be a chance to alter the application to give you not simply fire, but other elements, but we can discuss that in more detail later.”

General Thornsides motioned into the dark, and two more people rolled in a mechanical suit. He pointed at the suit and spoke, “This is your other option, son. We will outfit you with some high tech equipment, also produced by C.O.D.F.I.S.H. Inc.” The general, Scott noticed, rolled his eyes at that statement. He continued, “The lab people will have to give you some exoskeleton enhancements, seeing as your body went through so much damage. However, that support comes with a lot of fun armament and tools to play with. The major highlight is this: PHASE tech. When activated, the whole suit, you included, will be able to walk into walls, through the solid material, and reappear on the other side. The PHASE tech also allows for bullets, knives, and even flames to pass through you unhindered. I personally witnessed the first field experiments. You become a ghost. However, there is a potential for failure: organic material testing. These field experiments were done before Chantal appeared on the scene. We don’t know if a PHASE is possible through the dragon scales, or if you will even be able to slip through her skin if she tries to smash you with a fist of flesh and bones. If you accept, we can offer a few simple work-out tests, to give you the chance to figure out the entire tech beforehand.”

Scott’s silence lingered in the room, as he contemplated his choices. Both gave him tremendous advantages over a mere human to challenge Chantal. He looked to the two gentlemen, and in his husky whisper, he replied …
121322.title: The Feds say “Only YOU can prevent Dragon Fire”

1213222.content:
Sir Geon nodded his head, accepting Scott’s choice. “Very well, you should rest now for a few hours. After all, you just finished two days of intense reconstructive surgery. We can start your transformation in the morning, followed by a few days of study and examination for scientific purposes.”

“Rest, nothing. We don’t have time. Those girls will smash San Francisco building by building, and by the time you finish testing me, they could be long gone – either hiding out or destroying even more lives. Doc, give me that serum now.”

Abruptly, Sir Geon glared at Scott’s body. “ABSOLUTELY NOT. You need your rest. You barely survived the surgeries; you should be in more surgeries and recuperation therapy for six months, AT LEAST! Now, you are scheduled to test an unstable and rather dangerous serum that may kill you, kill everyone around you, or dement your personality that you may join up with Chantal against the rest of humanity. Besides, there are details for the testing and application process that need to be worked out, and your rest period will allow for all the arrangements to be made.”

The General nodded his head and agreed, “The doctor is correct, son. You should lie still for a few hours, rest, and allow your body to stabilize itself, especially from all the pain killers we used for the grafting surgeries. Besides, the study part may come in handy for duplication, to give you backup commandos, or even to use for wounded veteran surgeries and limb regeneration –much, much later. Rest up son, and we can continue in the morning.”

Before Scott could make another objection, both officials slipped away from the table. The surgical light turned off, plunging the room into darkness. Scott shifted about trying to find a comfortable position to rest in.

*&*&*

The next morning, Scott woke up to the movement of his hospital bed, as some orderlies pushed the bed out of the hospital complex, aboard an ambulance, and drove to an airport on the far side of the base. There was much organized chaos on the tarmac, as the scientific teams of Sir Geon were finishing the set up of their scientific, observational and recording equipment inside of an emptied plane hangar.

When the orderlies rolled Scott out of the ambulance and into the perimeter area, General Thornsides greeted Scott. He barked out, “Finish setting up those cameras and securing the perimeter. There are to be no civilians within one half mile of the test area.” Looking at Scott, he explained, “In your condition, and with the tight time table of this crisis, we wanted to use the open space, in case you did develop an unexpected growth spurt. We found a closed roof environment with the space to allow growth and flight room. The airport here is open, close to the hospital, but open to prying eyes, both curious and unfriendly types. Also, we had to clear out the excess vehicles and equipment to make room for the science stuff. Come; let us get you set for your part in this endeavor.”

Rolling up to the testing area, Scott observed how the scientists had prepared a medical crash cart, slightly out of sight behind the observing areas. He gulped to himself, hoping that the cart wouldn’t be necessary. The male nurses loosened the straps for Scott, and stepped away behind the observation barriers. Sir Geon approached at a crisp pace, pushing a medical supply cart. The two men greeted each other, and Scott tried to raise himself into a sitting position. Sir Geon stopped him, explaining, “We want you as relaxed as possible; I need to attach some monitors and we’ll begin.”

Lying back down, Scott waited as the scientists finished the preparations. The monitor pads felt extra sticky on the raw muscle when application to the burnt skin failed. When the cameras were all set up, Sir Geon gazed at Scott and ordered, “Begin camera recordings.” He waited a moment, and announced, “Begin medical recording of subject Draco Man’s vitals. I apologize about the nickname, but eventually all military projects pick one. This is Scott Cross, resident of former Los Angeles. His body is covered by third degree burns on over three-quarters of his skin. We will begin with a sponging application of Experimental Substance 619. This is believed to be the substance that produced Chantal the Dragon Giantess.”

Sir Geon donned surgical gloves, and turned his back to Scott. “We will begin with application on the lower left arm. Once we have seen a reaction, we will determine whether to continue the application on the other limbs.” A dripping noise caught Scott’s ear, and Scott licked his lips in anticipation. Sir Geon turned back to Scott, holding a small tray with a red glowing sponge. The glow of the liquid reflected on the camera lenses and off the tray. The doctor inhaled through his surgical mask, and instructed Scott to hold out his arm. “For the sake of a violent reaction, we will need to strap the left arm down. I will apply from the wrist to the elbow.” An orderly came up and belted the left arm to the gurney. “I am applying the ES-619 now.” The doctor took the sponge in hand, and lowered it towards the blackened skin. Heaving a sigh, he rubbed the skin with surgical strokes from Scott’s wrist to the crook of the elbow.

At first, nothing happened. While the cameraman took a few moments to zoom in on the application site, the scientists began to realize that his skin was peeling. In bits and pieces, the burnt skin started shedding, leaving raw muscle. Then, Scott screamed. The doctor stepped back, as dragon scales breached in rows of armored peaks. Then, like falling dominoes, the scales topped the fresh flesh, from elbow to wrist.

When that finished, the process repeated itself. The crispy flesh on the hands began to flake, while strips of new tissue began to appear on the upper left arm. When scales pierced the fresh muscles, Scott screamed in fresh agony. After 5 minutes of rippled waves of pain and anguish, Scott’s whole left arm was covered in transparent scales, showing the muscles and nerves growing and mending under the new reptilian skin.

Sir Geon breathed a sigh of relief. He approached Scott, and pointed at the arm. He announced for the cameras, “The transforming scales of ES-619 have covered the whole left arm, from fingers and hand, through the lower arm’s application site, and up to the shoulder and armpit. The scales are clear; underneath the new scaly armor, the muscles are still repairing themselves. For the next step, we will apply the formula to Scott’s other limbs. Strap them down, gentlemen.”

The orderlies followed his instructions. The doctor applied the sponge in careful strokes, one limb at a time. The process took nearly a quarter hour. Cameras recorded the skin’s changes. Monitors recorded accelerated heart responses. Audio mikes recorded vocal agony. By the time the changes subsided, Scott’s limbs were covered in bands of reptilian armor, and most of the burn damage was repaired. The muscles showed new signs of bundled strength, and the bones were thicker to support the weight of the new muscle and scales.

The doctor stood watching, as did the general, scientists, and all the rest. Sir Geon approached once more. The red sponge dipped down toward the chest and smeared a straight line from sternum to pelvis. The scales flowed outward to the left and right, making rows of miniscule triangles facing down towards the legs. When the scales of the chest reached the limbs, they interlinked into a seamless pattern.

Sir Geon looked up, and faced the cameras. He explained, “The scales now cover all four limbs, the lower and upper chest. The only flawed areas seem to be the facial area and the backside. Now, to reach the back, we will need to get you unstrapped from the table and flip you over, Scott.”

The orderlies moved forward and loosened the straps on the gurney bed. Scott started to lift himself onto his elbows, and rolled onto his side. The burn scars on his back stood red and blistered compared to the clear, front side scales. The arms and legs were completely encircled in scales; the chest scales made a jagged boundary short of the back side. Scott lay down on his chest, exposing his back to the cameras.

“Now to give the final application.” The crowd held their breath. The sponge was rubbed around Scott’s blistered spine. Scott hissed in repressed pain as the skin started to peel and scales started to appear. Within two minutes, the back side was completely covered, completing the body armor. Internal restoration of muscle tissue seemed to continue under the transparent, thick scales. Sir Geon leaned over Scott, and inquired, “How do you feel?”

Scott flexed his fingers and toes, stretched his arms, and moved his legs. “Everything seems to be connected and working properly.” He rolled his shoulders, and tried to sit up. He showed no signs of pain, and the muscles rippled with his movements. Some of the cameramen walked around, recording his repairing tissue and his body movements. Scott strained and announced, “I don’t feel any tail or wings. Are they there?”

Checking his back, Sir Geon noted, “There are muscle and bone bulges on your shoulders and at the base of the spine. They have not broken the scales yet, but they are swelling exponentially. Perhaps the elemental exposure will be the catalyst to initiate the dragon limb developments.”

Scott cocked his head. “Element what?”

“We believe that the lab explosions that Chantal was exposed to during her accidental application of the dragon serum resulted in her development of fierce fire breath and explosive projectile usage. From the items here in the airport hanger, you should be able to choose a few elements. Your first exposure to the item should influence your powers as a dragon-man. You may be able to choose two, but it may not work that well. At this point we are unsure of the pairing abilities. So…”
1213222.title: Scales for the charred skeleton, and what element?

12132221.content:
Scott looked at the stuff in the hanger. Peering into one corner, he saw something that intrigued him. “What about the chopper blades?”

Everyone looked to the corner where Scott was staring. A half-torn chopper, salvaged from Los Angeles, was in disrepair along the wall. The tail rotor blades were loaded on an army truck to be salvaged for scraps.

“I think those rotors would make for some cool dragon wings,” Scott hoisted himself into a sitting position on the gurney. He dangled his legs off to the side, and was about to stand.

“Whoa! What are you doing?” Sir Geon screamed at Scott Cross. A bunch of orderlies prepared to rush forward and suppress the patient.

Scott tensed up. He held up his hands in a surrender pose and replied calmly, “I was going to walk over to the rotor blades. That way, you could get footage of my recovery before and after being exposed to stuff. Plus, I wanted to test my leg strength with the scales, bones and new muscle mass.”

The doctor looked to the general, who nodded in acknowledgment of Scott’s plan. The general ordered the cameras to keep rolling, and the doctor ordered the orderlies to give Scott space.

Hopping off the medical gurney, Scott wobbled slightly on his new legs. He kept his arms out, balancing as on a tight-wire. He whispered to himself, ‘I am not going to become a stupid dragon with gurney powers. Stay strong, stay focused.’ With wobbly steps, he moved forward towards the wreckage of the helicopter. The crowd watched, as the scaly human moved to the edge of the area, coming close to pass by the medical monitoring equipment.

A power cord tripped Scott. He could not lift his foot over the cords powering the heart monitors. Zap! In a flash of white light, Scott was gone.

“Where did he go?” screamed General Thornsides, “What in the flames of hell just happened? You never said that he could vanish!”

The doctor stared astonished at the power cord where Scott had just stood. “Sir, I don’t know … but I don’t think he vanished on purpose.” Sir Geon walked over to the cables and knelt down by the cables. Waving over one of the maintenance men, he asked, “Was this cord frayed earlier?”

“No sir! All of the equipment was perfect earlier. The wires should be fine.” Leaning down, the worker shook his head, and swore. “Sir, this wire looks like someone took a knife to it. But if it was live, they should have been knocked out of their boots.”

“Or have the lightning of God Almighty put into their bones,” Sir Geon mused.

Crackling and flickering, Scott’s face replaced the digital screens on the monitors. “Whoa, where am I?” His voice came out of the speakers, spooking nearly everyone, “The last thing I remember was stepping on the cables of the equipment. It tingled. I know that sounds stupid, but it tingled, and then I was here.”

Sir Geon rushed over to one of the cameras, and then man-handled it to look at him. “Scott, the evidence shows that you grew claws, and your claws sliced into an electric wire. Your body’s new dragon DNA accepted the shock as your first power. Now, at this point I am hypothesizing, but you can now control the electrical devices you inhabit!”

Scott blinked on screen, “That … is … AWESOME! Hang on, let me try something.”

A flicker appeared on screen, and the digital monitors came back to life. Another second passed, and the lights in the whole hanger started flashing on and off in quick succession.

“Is that a … SOS signal?” General Thornsides asked before a buzz saw in the mechanic’s corner of the hanger whirred to life. Some of the camera operators whipped their recording devices to that corner. The saw buzzed on and off to the tune of ‘Shave and a Haircut’: Buzz, Buzz, Buuzz, Buzz, Buzz, Buzz … Buzz, Buzz.

Over by the mangled helicopter, a flash of yellow and white light caught everyone’s attention. Standing by the wall socket was a bright yellow creature. It took everyone a few seconds to react; the reactions ranged from doctors jumping in surprise to guards attempting to defend the science group. Only Sir Geon and the General were able to bring the people in the hanger back under control.

“Hold fire! Do NOT shoot! That’s our test subject!” yelled the General at his soldiers and guards.

“Keep rolling! Don’t let him out of your sight! That’s our test subject!” Sir Geon directed his medical group and the camera crews.

Scott’s appearance had changed from his exposure. His scales had taken on a mixture of colors from gold to neon yellow. His muscles had finished growing and mending, for the final appearance of a body builder athlete. His legs were lithe, but coiled with power. His arms bulged, ready for action, whether lifting a truck or punching holes in sheet metal. All of this was visible under the translucent yellow scales, giving an appearance of yellow aviator glasses. A tail had appeared: a thin black cord started just above his pelvis back and pooled in a pile of coils behind his feet. The end of the tail flicked, showing prongs that reminded everyone of a living power extension cord. Claw nails had grown on both the hands and feet with a jagged lightning bolt shape and solid golden color. Only his face had remained human and unchanged. The burnt tissue of his cheeks and nearly missing nose killed the magnificence of his transformation. The glint in his eyes showed his survival intelligence and the thirst for revenge.

Scott finished admiring his new appearance and walked over to the rotor blade in the truck bed.

“Wait please!” Sir Geon cried out, “We still want to test you at this stage and understand your new developing abilities.”

“That’s why I messed with the lights and appliances—to test my powers.”

“At least may we extract some scales to see what the serum has done to your body at this point?” The doctor pleaded with his draconic patient across the hanger floor.

Rolling his head, Scott scraped his clawed fingers up his arm, pulling back rows of yellow scales and carving out a sliced sample of his new skin. After he pulled the sample free, Scott flung the sliced skin to the floor. Before he took another step, Scott’s scales and skin had grown again, repairing the arm’s damage. Rushing over, one of the orderlies picked up the sample bits from the floor and put them in a medical Petri dish for examination later. Ignoring the underling, Scott asked the doctor if that was enough samples.

Sir Geon had approached by then, towing both the camera people and some of the other scientists. “That is plenty. Please continue and we’ll record anymore transformations.”
12132221.title: Hummer Batteries and Chopper Blades = Hummingbird

choices: Scott, fully rested, tests newest skills under supervision
The Draco Man breaks free and bolts towards revenge in San Francisco
121322211.content:
Sir Geon had approached by then, towing both the camera people and some of the other scientists. “That is plenty. Please continue and we’ll record anymore transformations.”

Scott reached out to the rotor blade. His claws touched the metal first, carving divots in the metal as he moved his hand in closer. Once the palm of his hand touched the metal, the dragon reaction occurred. The metal liquefied, encircling his hand, wrist, and arm in a metallic cocoon. In a rush, the metal seemed to encase Scott’s arms, chest, and neck in thin metal waves. Leaving no trace of the original rotor blades, all of the metal was being absorbed into the dragon scales on the body. The molten metal began to climb up his neck and to swiftly encase Scott’s head. Too shocked by this development, no one approached him to see if he needed help. Congealing to the shape of his disfigured face, the metal took on a final form. The spherical crown of his head glistened with a smooth sheen. Two lenses emerged out of the metal: half moon shapes with the straight edge downward, tinted in an aviator’s yellow shade. Scott could see the hanger with a tinted golden light. He blinked, and witnessed an image of thermals perspective; blinking again, he saw skeletal images familiar with X-ray, and a third blink returned his vision to normal. “Doc, I think the lenses let me see stuff in thermal and X-ray vision. This is wicked cool.” By this time, the metal helmet had finished molding a lower jaw, resembling the snout of a dragon. The helmet stayed free on the bottom, allowing Scott to talk naturally and without hindrance.

Circling around Scott, a cameraman noticed the twitching bulges on Scott’s back. In a single movement, the pair of wings emerged from the scaled hide and protective metal jacket on Scott’s back. Gaping in awe, the scientists gawked and marveled at their shape and design. They were not conventional dragon wings. Instead, the wings looked like helicopter rotor blades. There were two large blades, one embedded near each shoulder blade. Two slits appeared on the back, parallel to the spine, but traveling about a third of the ribcage’s length.

“This is so cool,” Scott exclaimed, as he took a step forward to balance himself. The bladed wings blurred—briefly—helping Scott right himself. When finished, the new wings folded downward, visually disappearing along the slits in Scott’s back. “Did my wings just go inside me? So gross.”

Sir Geon reexamined some footage presented by the primary camera operator. He announced, “The wings folded down your back, covering and sealing up your back slits. I can see from the slow-motion on the footage that your wings are traveling up and down the slits, somehow. Why don’t you step into the center of the room, and we can test your wings a bit, along with any other skills you want to?”

Scott nodded, and started to teeter-totter out of the mechanic corner of the hanger and back to the medical tests set up area. The extra weight of the metal-morphing scales, the wing blades and the power-cord tail altered his original center of balance. Not only that, his body was still recovering from the intense surgeries that got him this far. He made it back to the gurney in the room’s center. “Hey Doc, can I lie down? I think that exhaustion thing you talked about just caught up,” Scott wheezed as he collapsed onto the gurney, face-planting the pillow.

The gurney bowed from the heavy mass of the new Draco Man, but it did not break. Soon, the sound of snoring rose from Scott’s resting body.
The General pointed at Scott Cross. “This man is an asset to the future of our military might and our medical advancements. Strap him to the gurney and continue to monitor his body’s developments. Take tissue samples, scale samples, body measurements, wing measurements, tail measurements, and whatever else you can think of to measure, weigh, or analyze,” the General ordered the doctor. He growled, “If the man grows so much as a foot in his sleep, I want to know. Hell, if he grows 6 inches, I want to know so we can contain him before we have another Chantal.”

The general looked around to the guards. He barked new orders, “The perimeter is now locked down. No intruders and no departures. Double check all identification. Anyone who objects or resists is to be detained in complete isolation or shot, whichever maintains this secret best.”

Sir Geon objected in shock, “That is too extreme, General Thornsides!”

“No it is NOT! This project is a national secret. We cannot have a media leak, for Chantal might get wind of it. If she kills him, or captures him, or coerces his support, we have lost our best and fastest shot at knocking her out.” He started walking to the open hanger doors, giving the final orders, “Close these doors, and secure the perimeter. And Sir Geon, keep monitoring the Draco Man through the night. We can continue testing his new skills and abilities either later this evening, or first thing tomorrow, if he sleeps really deep.”

The guards separated into groups: two started the automated closing of the hanger doors, a group started a sweep to check identification badges, and a group split off to secure the exits and reinforce the perimeter of the hanger.

Sir Geon sighed and made his own set of announcements. He instructed everyone, “Please comply with this set of security measures. Get your IDs checked and get back to work. Camera crews, continue recording our friend, Mr. Scott, but also make sure your cameras are fully charged and operational. Analysts, please log the morning’s recordings, and begin analyzing the footage and biological readings. Orderlies, we have samples to collect. Secure the patient, gather your supplies, and one of the doctors will direct your sample collecting duties. Doctors, please come together over by the monitoring machines so I can give you your assignments."
121322211.title: Completing the Hummingbird Transformation

125.content:
As soon as Scott was finished off, Chantal laughed loudly and picked up his charred corpse and devoured it. She then lets out a sigh. "Too bad," she says. "Never a challenge. But as pathetic as they were, there might be forces outside of my city who would destroy me." Chantal scratches her chin with one of her claws. "Which gives me a fine idea. I know exactly what to do." Chantal blows smoke out of her mouth as she gets an evil look on her face and stomps off.

Chantal makes her way over to the old White Oak building, the chemical company responsible for her becoming the monster she is now. "Ah," she says as she reaches into the ruins. "I remember this building." Exactly ten years ago, Chantal had graduated from high school and went to work at the White Oak company. It was a chemical company that was trying to find a way to create a dragon. They believed dragons once existed for real and were trying to recreate one of these powerful beasts.

Unfortunately, something terrible happened that would create the dismal future that is now. Chantal was carrying the tank containing the ooze that would become the dragon. There was an Earthquake and Chantal dropped the tank, spilling the dragon formula all over herself. It changed her from an 18 year old girl into a giant fire breathing immortal monster. She enjoyed her new form a little too much and soon, took over the entire city. No one else from the White Oak building is alive to this day.

As Chantal reaches into the remains of the building, she has an evil thought in her head. She would create an army of dragon women to dominate the world. An army she would rule over with a fist of pure iron. She knew that even if the building had been abandoned, there were still tanks left containing the dragon formula that she could easily recreate with her scientific knowledge. As she moves her hands through broken metal and charred skeletons, Chantal feels something. She gives an evil look as she takes out a tank of the very same ooze that turned her into what she is now.

"Time to expand my territory." She says as she breathes out a stream of fire and then spreads her wings to fly beyond the city, beyond the country.
125.title: To Make Another Dragon

1252.content: Chantal decides to head East, towards Asia as she gives an evil look. "How ironic," she said. "Having Eastern dragons for my army of evil." This was true. Chantal knew that in Asian mythology, dragons were almost always good compared to their western counterparts. However, she also knew that there might be some truly evil girls around the world, even in countries where dragons were good. This also gave her an element of surprise for the people of this continent would fail to see the imminent danger of a giant dragon girl for they wouldn't see a dragon as being evil or destructive. If Chantal played her cards right, she could rule over Asia with her new dragon second in command. The only question is, where to go?
1252.title: A Beast in the East

1253.content:
As Chantal flies off carrying the dragon formula, she decides to head West to Europe. "Ah," she says. "Europe. Home sweet home. Almost makes me nostalgic." Chantal had been in Europe before. She was born in France, but she hadn't been there since she was a baby, though she did know how to speak her home country's language. "Perhaps," she says with an evil toothy grin. "I can count on support from the homeland. Perhaps my fellow countrywomen would like to be dragons. But wait. Maybe I can return dragons to a land where they have always been a problem."

Chantal was thinking of England, how she hated that country. She figured that bringing back one of their dragons in the form of a woman would be the perfect revenge. But then she realizes something. "Do I really want one of those snobbish Englishwomen to be my dragon warriors? Maybe I can find a dragon in a more ferocious setting. What about Russia? Sure, it's cold, but I'm sure a little dragon breath will heat things up in no time."

All of these ideas sounded like perfect touches. But what was Chantal going to do. Where will she go in the West to create her second in command of her ferocious dragon army?
1253.title: She heads West

choices: Another monster escapes and causes trouble
Chantal gets another monster to be her roommate
13.content:
Chantal lounges on the ground on her back and lets out a sigh. It had been like this for ten years now. Ever since that faithful day. She was hired by a chemical company that was trying to find a way to create a dragon for the military. They believed that dragons would be the ultimate weapon against the country's enemies, a way to end war immediately. Chantal was in charge of the dragon project. Unfortunately, the vial containing the dragon formula cracked and the fluid leaked onto her, transforming her from a human, into a half dragon monster.

She was horrified at what she had become. And things were only going to get worse for her. You see, Chantal was abducted by the military and relocated to kaiju island, an island used to jail all sorts of mutant monsters, somewhat similar to a zoo. Chantal hated it and was treated like an animal with nothing to do.

As she was remembering how she got into this mess, a crane lowers a cow into her "habitat" which she proceeds to roast with her flame breath and eat. She lets out another sigh and turns around, using her wings as a blanket. What is on Chantal's docket for the day?
13.title: Island Life

131.content:
Chantal expected today to be the day the island was opened to the public. They got to stare at the freakish monsters on the islands, orphaned by the corporate and military projects that spawned them. A lot were just dumb beasts, victims robbed of their humanity by equally inhuman and monstrous beings who drove profit and security from formless, nonexistent threats before all else. Chantal usually just used the time to sleep. At most, the visitors got a view of her gorgeous body. She was a little self-conscious at first, but had grown impervious to the hungry stares of the people who came to gawk.

Chantal was caged in a rather small pen for the week, so she could be marketed to the public in the world's largest freak show. Guard towers ringed her encampment, guns trained on her at all times. Chantal quietly doubted they could hurt her but kept it quiet. That might let her escape one day.

"Step right over here folks and come see the dragon lady!" A carnival announcer voice called. Chantal cursed herself for not keeping track of time. She should have appeared asleep, now she had to deal with the people telling her to show off. The announcer droned on about her size and abilities while people took pictures of her. Chantal did like the attention a little, but only as the acknowledgement of her power. The man said something about fire breathing, and Chantal smirked. She had never once let anyone look closely enough at her anatomy to determine how she did it.

"And now to demonstrate her voracious appetite, we release a herd of cows into the pen. Watch how quickly they'll be gone!" He called. Chantal fought down revulsion.

'Now they want me acting like a stage animal!' she thought in outrage. Maybe they recognized her power in a way they know a lion is dangerous, but not while safely contained. Something inside her snapped. She stepped through the herd towards the gate, feeling the animals crunch under her feet. The herd mooed in terror and fled from her. Soon, the tiny people that kept her locked up would sympathize with the trapped animals. The gasps of horror from the crowd were audible like music to her ears. Standing next to the gate, flanked by two guard towers, Chantal turned and faced them.

"You want a show? I'll give you a damn show!" She yelled. Then she looked down on one of the towers, which came up to about her shoulder. Opening her mouth, she poured fire onto the structure. In seconds it had melted down to ashes from the intense heat. Behind her, she heard even more screaming. Other towers were rushing to become combat ready. She waved her tail, which had sprouted from her lower back, and cut the tower neatly in half. It plummeted to the ground where she stepped on it, turning it to a pile of matchsticks. Another tower was set on fire, but allowed to slowly burn. The last three had opened fire on her. A harpoon sprang from one and cut into her skin. It stung, but angered her more. She looked at the men holding the weapon and yanked her harpooned arm. The gun, firmly rooted to the observation deck, didn't budge. The tower as a whole however, tilted erratically and plunged earthwards. Chantal walked to the final two towers. From both .50 caliber machine guns chattered harmlessly away. They hurt a little, but for the sake of the show Chantal hid it. From one, the giantess grabbed all four occupants in her hand.

"I've decided I will no longer be eating cows, my visitors. These are much more fitting a meal for a creature such as myself!" she declared, dangling one man over her open jaws. They were all screaming now, none more so than him. A deep chuckle resonated from her throat, sending wisps of smoke writhing around his body. All of a sudden, he felt himself falling downwards, past fiery eyes, gleaming teeth, and pink tongue. He landed at the back of the throat and quickly fell down into the stomach. Chantal rubbed her stomach and moaned. Still holding three captives, she struck a pose. Looking down at her audience she blew them a kiss.

"Take a picture now guys!" she called. Turning back to the morsels in her palm, she breathed a brief spurt of fire. The soldiers burst into flames but didn't die instantly. Their screams continued until Chantal messily devoured them, blood and gore dripping down her perfect mouth to stain her alabaster skin red.

"I guess its time I head out. Thanks for being a great audience!" Chantal said sweetly. Bending over, she tore the final tower out by the roots. A gunner plunged over the side, bouncing off her soft breasts and plummeted to the ground. He might have been alive but Chantal couldn't tell. He certainly wasn't after her foot landed on his body, squishing it into the soft earth. Most of the cows had been trampled underfoot, turning the ground into a soft and sticky swamp. It squelched between her toes with each step. Chantal stepped right up to the glass observation window, giving the tourists a full view of her right up against the wall.

"Watch out!" Chantal hurled toe tower into the concrete wall. It smashed through the containment structure and the observation windows. She strode through the wreckage humming pleasantly, pausing to cruch a survivor under her big toe.
131.title: Tourist trap

1312.content:
Chantal had only the vaguest idea how bug the island was, but she knew what it held. Many of the most dangerous things on Earth were kept here to be further experimented on and refined into more deadly creatures. Most were just dumb beasts, like the cows she'd eaten, but with bigger claws. Chantal was disappointed at the fight the humans had put up. The adrenaline had come only from her absolute power over them. This would be fun, but the novelty would probably wear off someday. She would need adrenaline from killing something that would be a danger to her. Having to fight their nightmares would toughen up her former species fast enough. And if they didn't, maybe some of the monsters would be a challenge.

The dragoness lifted herself into the air with her massive wings. Gusts of warm air buffeted the ground and stirred up clouds of dust from the rubble. Already, Humvees and emergency vehicles were arriving to clean up the scene. They drove in a single-file convoy up the narrow dirt road leading to her enclosure. Chantal gave them a long breath of fire as she flew over the group. Most vehicles were set ablaze and reduced to molten slag. A few at the back managed to dodge off the road before she could bake them to a crisp. She laughed and let them live. Mankind would need those with quick reactions. In the distance, she could see the installation that ran the island. One building held the controls for every pen on the island. It was long and slender, reaching up 500 feet into the air. The bulbous too floor seemed to be balanced on a needlepoint. The entire structure resembled a drop of oil falling upwards. The giantess flew faster and the city rapidly grew larger. At the sight of her, air raid sirens blared. Various guards far below shot upwards at her. Chantal wasn't worried they'd hit her. She would accomplish her task soon enough.

Chantal angled her wings backwards, forcing herself higher. When she was right over the center structure she folded her wings against her back. Her feet became more dragon like, scaling over and growing huge claws. She plunged downwards towards the city. Her feet tore into the command center, which wasn't very strong. Iron and glass shattered against armored scales. Technicians, computers, and architecture fell downward and were crushed by the soles of her feet. The single strand of metal anchoring the bulb to earth was barely wider than one of her feet and broke just as easily as the top. Seconds later, she hit the ground with a *thud* and sending minor earthquakes through the island. Kneeling in the rubble Chantal noted the silence for a moment. Then various alien cries began to rise into the air. Slowly she stood and began to laugh. As more creatures joined in her laughter increased in volume. After a moment Chantal was laughing at the top of her lungs, deafening all those too close to her.

"Be free my children!" She cried between laughs as the cries of strange creatures turned into human screams.
1312.title: Freedom!

choices: We're going to die anyways, why not
13121.content:
"Who in blood-soaked Hell thought spiders were a good idea?" A frantic civillian chattered. Sam was clustered in a small lab building with the civillian, a guard, and his two research partners. They had seen their creations boil over the fences holding them in and decimate the crowds viewing them. While the spiders, vibrant shades of orange and yellow with hairless exoskeletons and slender legs, had been distracted feasting on the humans, Sam had slipped inside the hut. He quickly turned off the lights and barricaded the door to the connecting lab. A few others had slipped in seconds after. When the screams and shooting had died down, some had assumed the fight was over and it was safe to exit. Twenty dwindled down to four, and everything was silent. A few minutes later, the guard cut a path through the giant spiders while they fed on the lab's recent occupants.

"Why the fuck did giant spiders seem like a brilliant idea?" The man asked again, too loudly. Something clicked across the roof overhead.

"Quiet!" the guard hissed. He didn't look like any normal paramilitary man. The face seemed to round and plump, and the wire glasses didn't fit with the body armor splashed in spider blood. The civillian turned to him, eyes panicked, and shook madly.

"We need to get out of here!" he gasped. The guard looked down at him, trying to silence him with abrupt hand motions. It sounded like more spiders had joined the one on the roof.

"You'll bring them in here. Stop talking."

"They're going to suck out our insides man! Like juice!" his voice began to raise in volume.

"If you don't quiet down, I'll make you." The obvious threat went over the man's head. He was more terrified of the monsters outside the small lab than the mere man sitting next to him.

"Fuck that! I'm getting out of here!" he fairly screamed. He shifted to go for the door, but the guard grabbed him faster than seemed possible. With a hand over his mouth, he whispered to the man reassuringly as his eyes glazed over. In a moment all his struggles ceased. Gently, the body was lowered to the floor. Sam looked at the guard with a look half question half fear.

"Not dead, unconscious" the guard mouthed back. Sam nodded, not sure whether it would have been kinder to the guest to kill him before the spiders reached him. They were currently battering on the roof. It sounded like the lab next door, but he was prepared to see eight cold eyes peek in from a sudden hole in the ceiling. But the sound of splintering wood and metal came from the next lab over. Someone had been alive over there, as a chorus of shouts and screams picked up. There was a disgusting crunch, and something let out an inhuman squeal.

"YEAH!" someone screamed, and hit the animal again. Then a heavy thud as the spider must have died.

"Ted watch out!" another voice called. Then Ted was screaming, and there was a huge commotion next door. At least three other people were fighting with him, but Sam knew there were more than three spiders in the area. He could hear them on the roof and outside. Then the door on the other side was destroyed, and two more beasts came charging in. The fight was brutal, and the three seemed to still be alive.

"We should help them!" Sam's partner said, clutching a long knife in his hands. His other partner nodded, checking the saftey on her handgun. The guard looked at them with his cold, lifeless eyes.
13121.title: Spoiders

131211.content:
The guard looked at them a moment.

"Aaah, we're all going to die anyways. Let's get this over with," he finished grimly, pulling out a combat knife. They quickly unblocked the door. As soon as the last obstacle was moved, they exploded through the door and into the chaos. Tim was pinned under a dead spider, eyes gazing straight ahead and frothing at the lips. Two other people were backed into a corner, bashing away at the monsters with metal pipes. The third was struggling to keep the spider crouched over him from biting him. With a roar, the guard charged up to the spider and stabbed its armored carapace. With a squeal, it reared up and tore its back open as the knife was held still. The man on the floor struggled to his feet and finished it off with a short chop from a machete. The immediate threat dealt with, they turned to the two still in the corner. They watched as a fourth spider charged over the backs of the other three and sank its fangs into one person's chest. He barely had time to scream before the venom paralyzed him and he was dragged out through the ceiling. The other three also beat a hasty retreat as the humans began to outnumber them.

"Is anyone bit or bleeding?" The guard asked. Everyone checked themselves, but they were still standing which spoke for a lack of bites.

"We're good. Well, most of us. Tim's in bad shape. Who even are you people?" The surviving woman from the other room asked. Sam introduced himself, as did Christina and Frank his lab partners. The guard muttered Sergei before stalking around the room.

"I'm Kelly and this is Bill. We were from the lab over the hill, studying interdimensional phenomenon. When the power died, we were over here watching these things. Everyone else on our team was back at the lab," Kelly said. Sergei seemed uninterested until he suddenly walked up to her and began an interrogation.

"How many are you? Would it still be safe there? Did you drive here? Do you have any firearms? Was there an emergency phone line or radio there?"

"I-I'm not sure. We took a bus over here, the equipment was being quiet so we thought we wouldn't miss anything. We had five guards, and they were all armed. There's nothing there to get out when the power failed but..." she suddenly trailed off.

"It's not safe there. We should probably try somewhere else. Somewhere far away from here!" Bill added, glancing around nervously. He looked about to say something when the sounds of engines was heard. They gradually moved closer, and soon after bursts of automatic weapons. Shouted orders followed by more gunfire moved closer to the labs. Sergei waited until they could hear booted feet running nearby, then slowly opened the door.

"HEY! OVER HERE!" He called. A squad of armored, masked troopers turned their direction. They scanned the rooftops, trying to keep 360 degrees of vision as they approached the survivors.

"Come with us, we're evacuating the island. Do any of you have any injuries?" One man called through his mask.

"Two people injured, one bitten. In the shack. Where are we going?" Sergei replied. Two of the troopers ignored him and pushed into the small buildings. They emerged a second later, each lugging an unconscious person.

"Follow them, we're taking you to the harbor," the soldier said. The small group ran across the corpse and web-strewn ground. Other groups of soldiers were finishing off whatever spiders still lurked around. An enormous olive-drab truck loomed up from the faint fog, and Sam was quickly herded inside. Kelly and Frank followed him in, but the rest were herded into a more empty vehicle up ahead. Then they rumbled off away from the ruined exhibit.



About two miles up the road lay the interdimensional research lab. It was little more than a bus stop and a door into the hillside. But within was himanity's best window into other worlds. When the window was turned into a door and something came through, it was kept behind the firmest doors and highest voltage containment possible. But when the electronic locks and preventative electricity failed, it popped the twenty tons of solid steel off its hinges as easily as opening a can of chips. The lab had quickly become a slaughterhouse. Bodies were scattered haphazardly in horrible positions, wherever they'd been flung or left after it was done with them. Walls were coated in streaks of blood and strange signs written in the same liquid. At the end of the hallway, right next to the door to the surface, the visitor sat atop the lab's last inhabitant. The solitary guard tried to force the horrible monster off of him, but it merely held him down with one hand. When her pleasure had ended with a cry of ecstasy and a series of powerful spasms that battered her prey, she casually ripped through the kevlar armor and consumed the terrified guard. After the bulk of the good meat was gone, she flung the corpse over her shoulder where it splattered against a console. She found a labcoat and pants that almost suited her proportions. Finally, using a keycard that no one else would need, she stepped out into Earth's daylight and waved to a conveniently passing convoy.
131211.title: Final Stand

1312112.content:
Sam gazed at the convoy behind him. After a brief detour to pick up a survivor from some underground complex that Kelly identified as hers, their truck had taken the lead. Behind them was the medical Humvee that had picked up the blood soaked scientist. Kelly still wasn't talking about what was being held in the lab. But if someone had made it out, then it must have been under control.

Sam had heard tales of a dragon being kept on the island. If that thing was flying around somewhere, they might have problems. An ancient monster should present no problem to modern weapons, but it might take out a truck before being shot down. Sam very much appreciated being alive. So much so that when Frank inhaled sharply at something going on behind them, Sam too looked with a sinking feeling of dread.

The Humvee was rocking wildly back and forth, threatening to flip over. The canvas roof bulged and rippled, distorting the red cross into all sorts of hideous shapes. Sam could make out someone in the passenger's seat stick his head through the sheet separating the front from the back, and then get pulled in. Two shots were fired, and then the cab was soaked with blood. The rocking subsided as the truck began to slow. Their driver was unaware of this or didn't want to be involved, and drove on. The several soldiers in the back glanced fearfully backwards. The hired guns had no more interest in dying than anyone else, they said nothing. Then the truck turned a corner and the view behind them was obscured by a thick forest.



Lilith had fully expected to have to fight her way through every human on the island after emerging from her hole in the ground. But whatever had deactivated the defenses that kept her in also affected the rest of the island, and a full scale evacuation was underway. The medics had taken her into their vehicle readily enough once they saw the blood. After being laid down on a cot, they mostly ignored her. Several other people were lying around, their injuries either more serious or more likely to be treatable than hers. She had no idea how much blood a human held, but what coated her would have been a lot for anything. They had driven at least fifteen minutes before one of the medics had drifted over to her. He wore a suit of body armor she had found on the guards earlier, as well as a face mask and some plastic gloves. He spoke something in a language she didn't understand. She cursed herself for never bothering to learn whatever the natives spoke. It didn't matter too much now, the doctor had some idea of what he was doing. When he found no immediate sources of bleeding, he began to take off the shirt and do a more thorough examination. Five deep rips through the fabric left very little covered, but no wounds underneath. The man's brow creased, and Lilith began to worry. Maybe they wouldn't get as far as she had hoped. Then he grabbed her wrist to check her pulse, and she was a tad too slow to pull it away. When he saw her claws, he let out a scream of fear understandable in any language.

In an instant, she leapt on him and tore him apart. A few of the more conscious wounded tried to move or call for help. She went bed to bed, messily devouring them as quickly as she could. Since her captors had stopped sending "food" by deliveryman, she hadn't tasted fresh meat. It left her drained and irate, totally incapable of performing the acts her race needed to survive. When the tiny remains of six people lay scattered about the back, she felt much better. The energy that sustained her beyond her normal dimension burned with a new intensity. She may not have been up to full power, but it was close enough. She withdrew into herself, letting it flow to every point on her. And as the magic rippled through her skin like waves of freezing water, she began to grow. Her weight soon increased so that her rhythmic swaying rocked the vehicle on its axles. Her borrowed clothes were finished, and they only loosely draped over her body. Soon her back rubbed against the itchy roof, and the medical truck rocked wildly. Surely someone would notice! And sure enough, the other medic leaned in from between a curtain screening her from the driver. With a short burst of energy, she overwhelmed his body and caused him to explode. When this small outburst accidentally popped the driver as well, she laughed. The power would take some readjustment. Over the noise of the dying engine, she heard shouts and the tramp of boots as the vehicle was surrounded. Before one of the humans did something stupid, she accelerated her growth to its maximum rate. With a short gasp of pleasure and pain, she burst through the truck. Looking down from 200 feet at the wreck beneath her and the shocked humans next to her feet, she felt normal again.

She had begun to give up hope of anything exciting ever happening to her. She would work until she was old and weak, then die, and be forgotten. But when the wormhole had opened and sucked her through to wherever she was now, she relished the opportunity to break the monotony. The pitiful life forms here had no use of magic. They vaguely resembled her kind, size and several other differences aside. She still felt no remorse slaughtering them.

Her small mouth housed rows of razor sharp teeth, and molten gold eyes stared out on the realm beneath her. Her skin was a shade of orange that appeared to be eternally smoldering. Her curves were astounding on any world. Suddenly aware of her nudity, she wanted to clothe herself.
